content_type: SSA Disability Listing of Impairments (Blue Book) - Adult Sections

schema.description: Schema for storing individual pages from the SSA Blue Book disability listings.

url.description: The canonical URL of the web page. Should be unique.

title.description: The full title of the web page as found in the <title> tag.

listing_id.description: The numeric identifier for the disability listing (e.g., '1.00', '2.00'), extracted from the URL or Title.

listing_name.description: The descriptive name of the disability category (e.g., 'Musculoskeletal Disorders', 'Special Senses and Speech'), extracted from the Title.

is_adult_listing.description: Indicates if the listing pertains to adult disability criteria. Based on the sample data, this will always be true.

headings.description: A list of headings found on the page, preserving their level and text.

text.description: The text content of the heading.

table_count.description: The number of tables identified on the page.

content_excerpt.description: An excerpt (first 500 characters) of the main text content from the page. Useful for snippets; not the full content.

notes: 1. The 'Disability Evaluation Under Social Security' heading often contains concatenated text which might require further parsing if structured data from this specific heading is needed. 2. The 'table_count' field only reflects the number of tables; the actual table data is not captured in this schema. If table content is required, the schema would need extension (e.g., `tables: array of objects`). 3. All samples are 'Adult Listings'; if 'Childhood Listings' also exist, the `is_adult_listing` flag will correctly differentiate them. 4. `headings.text` and `content_excerpt` would benefit most from full-text indexing for efficient searching.
